alert.note: Alert for Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 4:45PM EDT until September 05 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Connecticut, including the following county, Windham. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and embedded thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen and additional heavy rainfall will continue in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Windham, Plainfield, Willimantic, Killingly, Brooklyn, Canterbury, Pomfret, Sterling, Hampton and Scotland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
